title: About Ethical Capital
text:
Founded in 2021, Ethical Capital Investment Collaborative is a Utah-registered investment adviser dedicated to proving that exceptional financial performance and uncompromising ethical standards are not only compatible—they’re synergistic.


To demonstrate that ethical investing delivers superior long-term returns while creating positive impact for investors, companies, and society.
We believe the traditional choice between profits and principles is a false dichotomy. Through rigorous analysis, transparent methodology, and unwavering commitment to both financial and ethical excellence, we’re building a new standard for investment management.





We prioritize honesty over marketing, transparency over opacity, and evidence over ideology. Our Truth-Seeking Analysis™ methodology ensures that our conclusions—positive or negative—are grounded in verifiable evidence.



Your interests come first, always. We operate under the highest fiduciary standards, with complete transparency about fees, conflicts, and investment rationale.



Our investment exclusions aren’t marketing gimmicks—they reflect our genuine commitment to avoiding harm while seeking companies that contribute to a more sustainable and just economy.



We regularly reassess our methods, acknowledge our mistakes, and evolve our approach based on new evidence and changing market conditions.






While many firms focus on excluding “bad” companies, we go further by actively seeking organizations that demonstrate:

Environmental Leadership: Genuine commitment to sustainability, not just compliance
Social Responsibility: Fair treatment of employees, customers, and communities

Strong Governance: Transparent leadership that creates long-term value for all stakeholders




Our investment decisions are grounded in: - Rigorous financial analysis using proven methodologies - Comprehensive ESG research with third-party verification - Historical backtesting with bias corrections - Ongoing performance monitoring and attribution



We invest for the long term, believing that companies with strong ESG practices are better positioned to navigate future challenges and capitalize on emerging opportunities.






We exclude companies involved in: - Fossil Fuel extraction, processing, and distribution - Weapons Manufacturing and defense contracting
- Factory Farming and industrial animal agriculture - Tobacco and Gambling industries - Poor Governance practices or human rights violations



Beyond exclusions, we actively evaluate companies on: - Climate action and environmental stewardship - Employee relations and community impact - Board diversity and executive accountability - Innovation in sustainable solutions



We track and report on: - Carbon footprint reduction in portfolios - ESG score improvements over time - Positive impact investments and outcomes - Avoided negative externalities




Registration: Utah-registered investment adviser (2021)
Structure: Limited Liability Company (LLC)
Regulation: SEC and state oversight compliance
Fiduciary Duty: Legal commitment to client best interests



Adherent to professional ethical guidelines
Ongoing professional education and certification maintenance
Regular compliance audits and regulatory reporting
Transparent fee disclosure and conflict management







We publish our investment methodologies, share our performance attribution analysis, and acknowledge both our successes and failures.



Clients receive comprehensive reporting on: - Portfolio performance vs. benchmarks - ESG impact metrics and improvements - Fee transparency and value analysis - Market commentary and outlook



Through research publications, presentations, and educational materials, we contribute to advancing the field of ethical investing.






Sloane Ortel brings extensive experience in quantitative analysis, ESG research, and portfolio management. Previously served in analytical roles at leading investment firms before founding Ethical Capital to bridge the gap between values and returns.
Education: Advanced degrees in Finance and Environmental Studies
Specializations: ESG integration, risk management, behavioral finance



Our investment decisions are made by committee, ensuring multiple perspectives and reducing individual bias in portfolio construction and company selection.

Ethical Capital Investment Collaborative LLC (“ECIC,” “we,” “us,” or “our”) is committed to protecting the privacy and confidentiality of our clients’ personal and financial information. This Privacy Policy explains how we collect, use, disclose, and safeguard your information when you visit our website or engage our investment advisory services.





When you engage our services or visit our website, we may collect:

Identity Information: Name, address, phone number, email address, date of birth, Social Security number
Financial Information: Investment accounts, income, net worth, investment objectives, risk tolerance
Professional Information: Employment details, employer information, professional designations
Communication Records: Records of phone calls, emails, and meetings
Website Usage: IP address, browser type, pages visited, time spent on site





Directly from You: Through forms, applications, consultations, and ongoing communications
From Third Parties: With your consent, from custodians, other financial advisors, or service providers
Automatically: Through website cookies and analytics tools
Public Sources: Information available in public records or databases








Investment Management: To provide personalized investment advice and portfolio management services
Account Administration: To open accounts, process transactions, and maintain records
Communication: To respond to inquiries and provide ongoing service
Compliance: To meet regulatory requirements and conduct required reporting
Service Improvement: To enhance our services and develop new offerings




We process your information based on: - Contractual Necessity: To fulfill our advisory agreement with you - Legal Obligation: To comply with securities regulations and other legal requirements - Legitimate Interest: To operate our business and improve our services - Consent: For marketing communications and certain website features







Service Providers: Custodians, technology vendors, compliance consultants (under confidentiality agreements)
Professional Advisors: Your CPA, attorney, or other advisors (with your consent)
Regulatory Authorities: When required by law or regulation
Legal Proceedings: When compelled by court order or legal process
Business Transfers: In connection with a merger, acquisition, or sale of assets

Share information for marketing purposes without consent
Provide information to unrelated parties for their commercial use

Encryption: Sensitive data is encrypted in transit and at rest
Access Controls: Strict access limitations based on job function and need-to-know
Regular Updates: Security systems and software are regularly updated
Employee Training: Staff receive ongoing cybersecurity and privacy training
Third-Party Assessments: Regular security audits and vulnerability assessments




We retain personal information for as long as necessary to: - Provide ongoing advisory services - Comply with legal and regulatory requirements - Resolve disputes and enforce agreements - Generally, records are retained for seven years after account closure or as required by law

You may: - Opt out of marketing emails by clicking unsubscribe links - Request removal from mailing lists by contacting us - Still receive service-related communications as necessary



Upon reasonable request, we can provide your information in a structured, commonly used format to facilitate transfer to another advisor.






Our website uses cookies and similar technologies to: - Remember your preferences and settings - Analyze website traffic and usage patterns - Improve website functionality and user experience - Provide personalized content when appropriate



We use analytics services (such as Google Analytics) to understand how visitors use our website. These services may collect information about your browsing behavior across multiple websites.



Our website may contain links to external sites. We are not responsible for the privacy practices of external websites and encourage you to review their privacy policies.






We provide additional protections for financial account information and maintain compliance with the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act and other financial privacy regulations.



Information about your ESG preferences and values-based investment criteria is treated as confidential client information subject to our highest privacy standards.




Our services are not directed to individuals under 18 years of age, and we do not knowingly collect personal information from children. If you become aware that a child has provided personal information to us, please contact us immediately.



While we primarily serve U.S. clients, if personal information is transferred internationally, we ensure appropriate safeguards are in place to protect your information.



We may update this Privacy Policy periodically to reflect changes in our practices, technology, legal requirements, or other factors. We will notify clients of material changes through: - Email notifications to active clients - Prominent notices on our website - Updates in regular client communications





Under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA), California residents have additional rights including: - Right to know what personal information we collect and how it’s used - Right to delete personal information (subject to legal and regulatory requirements) - Right to non-discrimination for exercising privacy rights



We comply with applicable state privacy laws and will honor similar rights where required by law.

title: ESG Integration
text:
Our ESG integration goes beyond simple screening to comprehensive analysis of how environmental, social, and governance factors impact long-term investment returns and risk profiles.





Climate Action: Carbon reduction targets and renewable energy transition
Resource Management: Water usage, waste reduction, sustainable sourcing
Environmental Risk: Regulatory compliance, pollution control, biodiversity impact
Innovation: Investment in clean technology and sustainable solutions





Employee Relations: Fair wages, benefits, diversity and inclusion
Community Impact: Local economic development, social programs
Product Safety: Quality control, consumer protection, public health impact
Supply Chain: Ethical sourcing, labor standards, human rights





Board Structure: Independence, diversity, oversight effectiveness
Executive Compensation: Alignment with long-term performance
Transparency: Financial reporting quality, stakeholder communication
Risk Management: Internal controls, compliance, ethical leadership







We gather ESG data from multiple sources: - Third-party providers: MSCI, Sustainalytics, Bloomberg ESG - Company disclosures: Sustainability reports, SEC filings - Independent research: NGO reports, academic studies - Direct engagement: Management interviews, site visits



Not all ESG factors are equally important for every industry: - Sector-specific risks: Climate impact varies by industry - Regulatory environment: Different compliance requirements - Stakeholder priorities: Customer, employee, community expectations - Competitive dynamics: ESG as differentiation or table stakes



ESG factors are integrated into financial models: - Risk adjustment: Higher discount rates for ESG risks - Growth projections: ESG leaders often have better growth prospects - Multiple expansion: ESG premium in market valuations - Scenario analysis: Stress testing for ESG-related disruptions




Our screening process aligns with goodness and avoids preventable harm to living things through systematic exclusion criteria:


We view ethical screening as a primary risk management tool, systematically excluding investments that pose “preventable harm as investment risk” including regulatory sanctions, reputational damage, stranded assets, operational disruptions, and reduced capital market access.




Harm to Living Beings: Companies whose products directly harm people or animals
Weapons and Military: Defense contractors and weapons manufacturers
Addictive Products: Tobacco, gambling, and other dependency-creating industries
Fossil Fuels: Oil, gas, coal extraction and processing companies
Extractive Industries: Mining and resource extraction with environmental impact
Surveillance Capitalism: Companies monetizing personal data without consent
For-profit Incarceration: Private prison and detention facility operators





Direct Harm and Rights Violations: Companies with documented human rights abuses
Environmental and Climate Misconduct: Persistent environmental violations
Governance and Operational Failures: Poor corporate governance and ethical lapses

Financial and Social Harm: Predatory lending and exploitative business practices





Growth Strategy: 100% direct implementation with high-conviction portfolios
Income Strategy: Flexible approach, preferring aligned managers
Diversification Strategy: Indirect implementation through aligned funds





Monthly portfolio reviews using internal research (no third-party ESG rating reliance)
Key performance indicator: “Do portfolio companies align with goodness and avoid preventable harm to living things?”







ESG analysis influences: - Security selection: Preference for ESG leaders within sectors - Position sizing: Larger allocations to companies with improving ESG profiles - Sector allocation: Overweight sectors with positive ESG trends - Risk management: ESG factor-based hedging strategies



We engage with portfolio companies on: - Climate targets: Science-based emission reduction goals - Diversity initiatives: Board and workforce diversity improvements - Supply chain ethics: Labor standards and human rights policies - Governance reforms: Executive compensation and board structure



Regular tracking of: - ESG score evolution: Improvement in company ratings over time - Carbon footprint: Portfolio-wide emission reductions - Engagement outcomes: Success rate of proxy voting and dialogue - Financial performance: ESG integration impact on returns






Examples of companies that demonstrated: - Strong ESG leadership driving outperformance - Effective risk management through ESG practices - Innovation in sustainable solutions creating competitive advantage



Cases where ESG analysis prevented losses: - Early identification of governance risks - Climate-related business model disruption - Social license to operate challenges




Our ESG integration process evolves through: - Research updates: Incorporating new academic findings - Data enhancement: Adding new ESG data sources and metrics - Methodology refinement: Improving quantitative integration techniques - Client feedback: Adapting to changing investor priorities

title: Our Team
text:
The experienced professionals behind Ethical Capital’s investment management and research capabilities.




Sloane Ortel leads ECIC’s investment strategy and research initiatives, bringing extensive experience in quantitative analysis, ESG research, and portfolio management.
Background: - Advanced degrees in Finance and Environmental Studies - Previous experience at leading investment firms - Specialized expertise in ESG integration and behavioral finance
Research Focus: - Truth-Seeking Analysis™ methodology development - Unbiased backtesting and performance attribution - ESG integration effectiveness research - Sustainable finance innovation




Our investment decisions are made by committee to ensure multiple perspectives and reduce individual bias in portfolio construction and security selection.


The team is united by commitment to: - Evidence-based investment decisions - Rigorous ESG analysis and integration - Transparent performance measurement - Fiduciary excellence in client service



All team members maintain: - Relevant professional certifications and education - Ongoing continuing education requirements - Compliance with fiduciary duty standards - Commitment to ethical investment principles






We work with leading academic institutions on: - Investment methodology validation - ESG research initiatives - Performance measurement standards - Behavioral finance studies



Regular engagement with: - ESG data providers and research firms - Regulatory bodies and standard-setting organizations - Peer investment management firms - Professional associations and industry groups




We’re always interested in connecting with professionals who share our commitment to ethical investing and analytical rigor.
